abstract: The new Pompidou Center in the northeastern French city of Metz is offering a rare opportunity to view Pablo Picasso's largest known painting, a stage curtain measuring over 34 feet by 54 feet, which he created for the avant-garde ballet "Parade" in 1917.

headline.main: Picasso's Largest Painting Goes on View in France
